channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Deep Backward and Galerkin Methods for the Finite State Master Equation
item.description: This paper proposes and analyzes two neural network methods to solve the master equation for finite-state mean field games (MFGs).

item.title: A Task-Driven Multi-UAV Coalition Formation Mechanism
item.description: With the rapid advancement of UAV technology, the problem of UAV coalition formation has become a hotspot.

item.title: Can't Remember Details in Long Documents? You Need Some R&R
item.description: Long-context large language models (LLMs) hold promise for tasks such as question-answering (QA) over long documents, but they tend to miss important information in the middle of context documents (arXiv:2307. 03172v3).

item.title: ECToNAS: Evolutionary Cross-Topology Neural Architecture Search
item.description: We present ECToNAS, a cost-efficient evolutionary cross-topology neural architecture search algorithm that does not require any pre-trained meta controllers.

item.title: Arbitrary-Scale Point Cloud Upsampling by Voxel-Based Network with Latent Geometric-Consistent Learning
item.description: Recently, arbitrary-scale point cloud upsampling mechanism became increasingly popular due to its efficiency and convenience for practical applications.

item.title: Simple Multigraph Convolution Networks
item.description: Existing multigraph convolution methods either ignore the cross-view interaction among multiple graphs, or induce extremely high computational cost due to standard cross-view polynomial operators.

item.title: SIRST-5K: Exploring Massive Negatives Synthesis with Self-supervised Learning for Robust Infrared Small Target Detection
item.description: The quality, quantity, and diversity of the infrared dataset are critical to the detection of small targets.

item.title: Face2Diffusion for Fast and Editable Face Personalization
item.description: However, it is still challenging for previous methods to preserve both the identity similarity and editability due to overfitting to training samples.

item.title: FedFMS: Exploring Federated Foundation Models for Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: The Segmentation Anything Model (SAM) serves as a powerful foundation model for visual segmentation and can be adapted for medical image segmentation.

item.title: LightM-UNet: Mamba Assists in Lightweight UNet for Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: This highlights the potential of Mamba in facilitating model lightweighting.

item.title: ACLSum: A New Dataset for Aspect-based Summarization of Scientific Publications
item.description: Extensive efforts in the past have been directed toward the development of summarization datasets.

item.title: Defending Against Unforeseen Failure Modes with Latent Adversarial Training
item.description: This suggests that LAT can be a promising tool for defending against failure modes that are not explicitly identified by developers.

item.title: Synthetic data generation for system identification: leveraging knowledge transfer from similar systems
item.description: This paper addresses the challenge of overfitting in the learning of dynamical systems by introducing a novel approach for the generation of synthetic data, aimed at enhancing model generalization and robustness in scenarios characterized by data scarcity.

item.title: Unity by Diversity: Improved Representation Learning in Multimodal VAEs
item.description: Such architectures impose hard constraints on the model.

item.title: Frequency-Adaptive Dilated Convolution for Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Dilated convolution, which expands the receptive field by inserting gaps between its consecutive elements, is widely employed in computer vision.

item.title: HistGen: Histopathology Report Generation via Local-Global Feature Encoding and Cross-modal Context Interaction
item.description: Histopathology serves as the gold standard in cancer diagnosis, with clinical reports being vital in interpreting and understanding this process, guiding cancer treatment and patient care.

item.title: LLM4Decompile: Decompiling Binary Code with Large Language Models
item.description: Therefore, we release the first open-access decompilation LLMs ranging from 1B to 33B pre-trained on 4 billion tokens of C source code and the corresponding assembly code.

item.title: BjTT: A Large-scale Multimodal Dataset for Traffic Prediction
item.description: The key challenge of the TTG task is how to associate text with the spatial structure of the road network and traffic data for generating traffic situations.

item.title: Unlocking the Potential of Multimodal Unified Discrete Representation through Training-Free Codebook Optimization and Hierarchical Alignment
item.description: The Dual Cross-modal Information Disentanglement (DCID) model, utilizing a unified codebook, shows promising results in achieving fine-grained representation and cross-modal generalization.

item.title: Spectrogram-Based Detection of Auto-Tuned Vocals in Music Recordings
item.description: In the domain of music production and audio processing, the implementation of automatic pitch correction of the singing voice, also known as Auto-Tune, has significantly transformed the landscape of vocal performance.

item.title: CommitBench: A Benchmark for Commit Message Generation
item.description: Writing commit messages is a tedious daily task for many software developers, and often remains neglected.

item.title: Bias-Augmented Consistency Training Reduces Biased Reasoning in Chain-of-Thought
item.description: Moreover, this model generalizes to other forms of bias, reducing biased reasoning on held-out biases by an average of 37%.

item.title: Attention-guided Feature Distillation for Semantic Segmentation
item.description: In contrast to existing complex methodologies commonly employed for distilling knowledge from a teacher to a student, the pro-posed method showcases the efficacy of a simple yet powerful method for utilizing refined feature maps to transfer attention.

item.title: DeepSeek-VL: Towards Real-World Vision-Language Understanding
item.description: The DeepSeek-VL family (both 1. 3B and 7B models) showcases superior user experiences as a vision-language chatbot in real-world applications, achieving state-of-the-art or competitive performance across a wide range of visual-language benchmarks at the same model size while maintaining robust performance on language-centric benchmarks.

item.title: ERBench: An Entity-Relationship based Automatically Verifiable Hallucination Benchmark for Large Language Models
item.description: Our key idea is to construct questions using the database schema, records, and functional dependencies such that they can be automatically verified.

item.title: SplattingAvatar: Realistic Real-Time Human Avatars with Mesh-Embedded Gaussian Splatting
item.description: We present SplattingAvatar, a hybrid 3D representation of photorealistic human avatars with Gaussian Splatting embedded on a triangle mesh, which renders over 300 FPS on a modern GPU and 30 FPS on a mobile device.

item.title: Debiasing Large Visual Language Models
item.description: In the realms of computer vision and natural language processing, Large Vision-Language Models (LVLMs) have become indispensable tools, proficient in generating textual descriptions based on visual inputs.

item.title: REPS: Reconstruction-based Point Cloud Sampling
item.description: Our method outperforms previous approaches in preserving the structural features of the sampled point clouds.

item.title: Benchmarking Micro-action Recognition: Dataset, Methods, and Applications
item.description: It offers insights into the feelings and intentions of individuals and is important for human-oriented applications such as emotion recognition and psychological assessment.

item.title: UFORecon: Generalizable Sparse-View Surface Reconstruction from Arbitrary and UnFavOrable Data Sets
item.description: Generalizable neural implicit surface reconstruction aims to obtain an accurate underlying geometry given a limited number of multi-view images from unseen scenes.

item.title: Stealing Stable Diffusion Prior for Robust Monocular Depth Estimation
item.description: This paper introduces a novel approach named Stealing Stable Diffusion (SSD) prior for robust monocular depth estimation.

item.title: VideoElevator: Elevating Video Generation Quality with Versatile Text-to-Image Diffusion Models
item.description: Different from conventional T2V sampling (i. e., temporal and spatial modeling), VideoElevator explicitly decomposes each sampling step into temporal motion refining and spatial quality elevating.

item.title: RFWave: Multi-band Rectified Flow for Audio Waveform Reconstruction
item.description: Recent advancements in generative modeling have led to significant progress in audio waveform reconstruction from diverse representations.

item.title: Agile Multi-Source-Free Domain Adaptation
item.description: Efficiently utilizing rich knowledge in pretrained models has become a critical topic in the era of large models.

item.title: Rethinking Transformers Pre-training for Multi-Spectral Satellite Imagery
item.description: Recent advances in unsupervised learning have demonstrated the ability of large vision models to achieve promising results on downstream tasks by pre-training on large amount of unlabelled data.

item.title: PrimeComposer: Faster Progressively Combined Diffusion for Image Composition with Attention Steering
item.description: This prior information is encoded into the attention weights, which are then integrated into the self-attention layers of the generator to guide the synthesis process.

item.title: Cross-Modal and Uni-Modal Soft-Label Alignment for Image-Text Retrieval
item.description: Furthermore, our method can also boost the uni-modal retrieval performance of image-text retrieval models, enabling it to achieve universal retrieval.

item.title: QAQ: Quality Adaptive Quantization for LLM KV Cache
item.description: The emergence of LLMs has ignited a fresh surge of breakthroughs in NLP applications, particularly in domains such as question-answering systems and text generation.

item.title: Active Generalized Category Discovery
item.description: Generalized Category Discovery (GCD) is a pragmatic and challenging open-world task, which endeavors to cluster unlabeled samples from both novel and old classes, leveraging some labeled data of old classes.

item.title: Embodied Understanding of Driving Scenarios
item.description: Hereby, we introduce the Embodied Language Model (ELM), a comprehensive framework tailored for agents' understanding of driving scenes with large spatial and temporal spans.

item.title: Learning to Remove Wrinkled Transparent Film with Polarized Prior
item.description: We aim to remove interference from the film (specular highlights and other degradations) with an end-to-end framework.

item.title: YYDS: Visible-Infrared Person Re-Identification with Coarse Descriptions
item.description: To this end, we present the Refer-VI-ReID settings, which aims to match target visible images from both infrared images and coarse language descriptions (e. g., "a man with red top and black pants") to complement the missing color information.

item.title: On the Use of Autoregressive Methods for Audio Inpainting
item.description: The paper presents an evaluation of popular audio inpainting methods based on autoregressive modelling, namely, extrapolation-based and Janssen methods.

item.title: TextMonkey: An OCR-Free Large Multimodal Model for Understanding Document
item.description: We present TextMonkey, a large multimodal model (LMM) tailored for text-centric tasks, including document question answering (DocVQA) and scene text analysis.

item.title: LeTac-MPC: Learning Model Predictive Control for Tactile-reactive Grasping
item.description: Our approach enables the gripper grasp objects with different physical properties on dynamic and force-interactive tasks.

item.title: Source Matters: Source Dataset Impact on Model Robustness in Medical Imaging
item.description: However, the domain shift from natural to medical images has prompted alternatives such as RadImageNet, often demonstrating comparable classification performance.

item.title: Speech Emotion Recognition Via CNN-Transforemr and Multidimensional Attention Mechanism
item.description: In this paper, to model local and global information at different levels of granularity in speech and capture temporal, spatial and channel dependencies in speech signals, we propose a Speech Emotion Recognition network based on CNN-Transformer and multi-dimensional attention mechanisms.

item.title: Aligning GPTRec with Beyond-Accuracy Goals with Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Adaptations of Transformer models, such as BERT4Rec and SASRec, achieve state-of-the-art performance in the sequential recommendation task according to accuracy-based metrics, such as NDCG.

item.title: BAGS: Blur Agnostic Gaussian Splatting through Multi-Scale Kernel Modeling
item.description: Recent efforts in using 3D Gaussians for scene reconstruction and novel view synthesis can achieve impressive results on curated benchmarks; however, images captured in real life are often blurry.

item.title: Computational Modelling of Plurality and Definiteness in Chinese Noun Phrases
item.description: In this paper, we focus on the omission of the plurality and definiteness markers in Chinese noun phrases (NPs) to investigate the predictability of their intended meaning given the contexts.
